intro: Pasaniopsis sieboldii, commonly known as the Japanese pasania, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, simple leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. It prefers shady, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects.
